docs.summary: Events that are triggered by actions on a site's members.
description: Events are triggered in your site's backend when certain changes occur to your site's members.
You can write event handlers that react to these events. Event handler functions
receive data that corresponds to the backend event that has occurred. Use event handlers
to create custom responses to the events.
Events are **not** triggered when previewing your site.
To add an event handler, add an **events.js** file to the **Backend** section
of your site if one does not already exist. All event handler functions for your
site are defined in this file.
Event handler functions are defined using the following pattern:
```javascript
export function <wixAppName>_<eventName>(event) { }
For example, an event handler that handles the approval of a site member looks
like this:
```javascript
export function wixMembers_onMemberApproved(event) { }

docs.summary: An event that is triggered when a  is .
description: The `()` event handler runs when a is .
The received `` object contains information about the  that was .
> **Note:** Backend events don’t work when previewing your site.

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the event that was canceled.

docs.summary: A backend event that fires when a Wix event is canceled.
description: The `onEventCanceled()` event handler runs when an existing Wix event is canceled.
The received `CanceledEvent` object contains information about the event that was canceled.
> **Note:** Backend events are **not** fired when previewing your site.

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the event that was created.

docs.summary: A backend event that fires when a Wix event is created or copied.
description: The `onEventCreated()` event handler runs when a Wix event is created or copied in your site.
The received `CreatedEvent` object contains information about the new Wix event that was created/copied.
> **Note:** Backend events are **not** fired when previewing your site.

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the event that was deleted.

docs.summary: A backend event that fires when a Wix event is deleted.
description: The `onEventDeleted()` event handler runs when an existing event is deleted.
The received `DeletedEvent` object contains information about the event that was deleted.
> **Note:** Backend events are **not** fired when previewing your site.

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the event that has ended.

docs.summary: A backend event that fires when a Wix event ends.
description: The `onEventEnded()` event handler runs when a Wix event ends.
The received `EndedEvent` object contains information about the ended event.
> **Note:** Backend events are **not** fired when previewing your site.

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the event that the reminder was sent for.

docs.summary: A backend event that fires when a Wix event's reminders are sent.
description: The `onEventReminder()` event handler runs when a Wix event is set to have a reminder
and the time of the reminder arrives.
The received `EventReminder` object contains information about the event.
Configure when the reminder is sent in the site dashboard.
> **Note:** Backend events are **not** fired when previewing your site.

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the event that has started.

docs.summary: A backend event that fires when a Wix event starts.
description: The `onEventStarted()` event handler runs when a Wix event starts.
The received `StartedEvent` object contains information about the started event.
> **Note:** Backend events are **not** fired when previewing your site.

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the event that was updated.

docs.summary: A backend event that fires when an existing Wix event is updated.
description: The `onEventUpdated()` event handler runs when an existing Wix event is updated.
The received `UpdatedEvent` object contains information about the event that was updated.
> **Note:** Backend events are **not** fired when previewing your site.

params.name: members
params.doc: Information about the site member that was approved.

docs.summary: An event that is triggered when a site member is approved.
description: The `onMemberApproved()` event handler runs when an existing site member is approved.
The received `ApprovedMember` object contains information about the site member that was approved.
> **Note:** Backend events don’t work when previewing your site.

params.name: event

docs.summary: An object representing the confirmed order.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Contact ID associated with this order.

members.name: memberId
members.doc: Member ID associated with this order.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Order status.
 One of:

 + `"FREE"`: Order is confirmed, no payment required.
 + `"PENDING"`: Order was paid, but the payment provider suspended the payment. Eventually changes to `"PAID"`.
 + `"PAID"`: Order paid using the payment provider.
 + `"OFFLINE_PENDING"`: Order confirmed, but has to be paid offline and status needs to be manually updated to `"PAID"`.
 + `"INITIATED"`: Order is awaiting payment.

members.name: method
members.doc: Payment method used. For example, "payPal" or "creditCard".

docs.summary: An object representing the deleted ticket order.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Contact ID associated with this order.

members.name: memberId
members.doc: Member ID associated with this order.

members.name: anonymized
members.doc: Whether the order was anonymized by a GDPR delete.

members.name: orderType
members.doc:
Order type.
 One of:

 + `"UNASSIGNED_TICKETS"`: Buyer form is used for all tickets.
 + `"ASSIGNED_TICKETS"`: Each order ticket has its own form.

docs.summary: An object representing the initiated order.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Contact ID associated with this order.

members.name: memberId
members.doc: Member ID associated with this order.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Order status.
 One of:

 + `"FREE"`: Order is confirmed, no payment required.
 + `"PENDING"`: Order was paid, but the payment provider suspended the payment. Eventually changes to `"PAID"`.
 + `"PAID"`: Order paid using the payment provider.
 + `"OFFLINE_PENDING"`: Order confirmed, but has to be paid offline and status needs to be manually updated to `"PAID"`.
 + `"INITIATED"`: Order is awaiting payment.

docs.summary: An object representing the updated order.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Contact ID associated with this order.

members.name: memberId
members.doc: Member ID associated with this order.

members.name: confirmed
members.doc:
Whether the order is confirmed An order gets confirmed
 when the payment gateway processes the payment and the funds reach the merchant's account.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Order status.
 One of:

 + `"FREE"`: Order is confirmed, no payment required.
 + `"PENDING"`: Order was paid, but the payment provider suspended the payment. Eventually changes to `"PAID"`.
 + `"PAID"`: Order paid using the payment provider.
 + `"OFFLINE_PENDING"`: Order confirmed, but has to be paid offline and status needs to be manually updated to `"PAID"`.
 + `"INITIATED"`: Order is awaiting payment.

members.name: method
members.doc: Payment method used. For example, "payPal" or "creditCard".

docs.summary: An object representing the created ticket reservation.

members.name: reservationId
members.doc: Reservation ID. Can be used to retrieve an invoice.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Reservation status.
 One of:

 + `"RESERVATION_PENDING"`: Reservation is pending confirmation. It will expire after expiration due time.
 + `"RESERVATION_CONFIRMED"`: Reservation was confirmed and will not expire.
 + `"RESERVATION_CANCELED"`: Reservation was canceled because of non payment.
 + `"RESERVATION_CANCELED_MANUALLY"`: Reservation was canceled manually by the buyer.

docs.summary: An object representing the updated reservation.

members.name: reservationId
members.doc: Reservation ID. Can be used to retrieve an invoice.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Reservation status.
 One of:

 + `"RESERVATION_PENDING"`: Reservation is pending confirmation. It will expire after expiration due time.
 + `"RESERVATION_CONFIRMED"`: Reservation was confirmed and will not expire.
 + `"RESERVATION_CANCELED"`: Reservation was canceled because of non payment.
 + `"RESERVATION_CANCELED_MANUALLY"`: Reservation was canceled manually by the buyer.

docs.summary: An object representing the created RSVP.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Contact ID associated with the RSVP.

members.name: memberId
members.doc: Member ID associated with the RSVP.

members.name: status
members.doc:
RSVP response status.
 One of:

 + `"YES"`: Guest is attending.
 + `"NO"`: Guest is not attending.
 + `"WAITING"`: Guest added to the wait list.
